moves.4. O-O Nf6: Attacks the undefended e pawn and develops the black knight at the same time.
moves.5. d3 d6 6. h3: Prevents Bg4 which would be pretty annoying to deal with.
moves.6... O-O 7. Bg5 Na5 8. Nbd2: He wins my LSB. I decided by play this to give my knight a good position.
moves.8... c6 9. a3: Creates an escape square for my LSB and prepare for a b4 advance(FORK)
moves.9... Nxc4 10. Nxc4 Re8 11. Qd2 b5 12. Ne: I win at least a pawn here.
moves.17. fxe3 Rxd8 18. Nxe5 c5 19. Nxf7 Re8 2: RAther boring ending. I could've gotten 3 pawns fpr a bishop but I wanted to be safe and go for the 3 fold repitition. I would've gained rating points even if I drew with him.
